abstract: Embodiments provide a computer implemented method, in a data processing system comprising a processor and a memory comprising instructions which are executed by the processor to cause the processor to train an enhanced chatflow system, the method comprising: ingesting, using a rule-based module, a corpus of information comprising at least one user input node corresponding to a user question and at least one expert-designed variation for each user input node; matching, using the rule-based module, one or more user inputs to one or more corresponding dialog nodes using regular expressions and delimiters; ingesting, using a statistical matching module, one or more usage logs from a deployed dialog system, each usage log comprising at least one user input node; for each user input node: designating the node as a class; storing the node in a dialog node repository; designating each of the at least one variations as training examples for the designated class; converting the classes and the t...
summary: <SOH> SUMMARY <EOH>Embodiments can provide a computer implemented method, in a data processing system comprising a processor and a memory comprising instructions which are executed by the processor to cause the processor to train an enhanced chatflow system, the method comprising: ingesting, using a rule-based module, a corpus of information comprising at least one user input node corresponding to a user question and at least one expert-designed variation for each user input node; matching, using the rule-based module, one or more user inputs to one or more corresponding dialog nodes using regular expressions and delimiters; ingesting, using a statistical matching module, one or more usage logs from a deployed dialog system, each usage log comprising at least one user input node; for each user input node: designating the node as a class; storing the node in a dialog node repository; designating each of the at least one variations as training examples for the designated class; converting the classes and the training examples into feature vector representations; training one or more classifiers using the one or more feature vector representations of the classes; training classification objectives using the one or more feature vector representations of the training examples; and incorporating the training of the classifiers and the classification objectives into enhanced chatflow system. Embodiments can further provide a method further comprising ingesting, using the statistical matching module, the expert-designed variations in addition to the usage logs. Embodiments can further provide a method further comprising expanding, using the rule-based module, the regular expressions and delimiters using synonyms harvested through one or more external data sources. Embodiments can further provide a method further comprising fixing the rule-based module such that no further alteration to the regular expressions or delimiters is allowed; ingesting, using the statistical matchi...
title: SYSTEM AND METHOD FOR ENHANCED CHATFLOW APPLICATION
